abstract.t: Routing for Low Power and Lossy Networks (RPL) is a routing protocoldesigned for Low power and Lossy Networks (LLNs). RPL includesrouting information in IPv6 data plane datagrams to help maintain therouting topology. When forwarding a datagram into a RPL domain, aRPL router may need to expand the datagram to include routinginformation in IPv6 Extension headers. A generic solution has beendefined that uses IP-in-IP tunneling to include RPL routinginformation. This document describes an alternative to inserting andremoving RPL information in datagrams without the use of IP-in-IPtunneling.
